Geography.1: Understand spatial variations in physical geography--climate, vegetation, and soils--on the surface of the earth.
Geography.2: Understand and appreciate the spatial, ecological, and regional dimensions of human life on the surface of the earth.
Geography.3: Understand how to use geospatial technigues, such as cartographic representation, GIS, and remote sensing in order to analyze and interpret geographic dimensions of life in the world.
Geography.4: Appreciate how the global and local are connected.
Geography.5: Have an appreciation of the history and philosophy of Geography, both past and present.
